result.execSummary:
The defendant Dartavius L Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with the defendant's other case. Defense motion for expungement denied by the court.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:

Pay supervision fees.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 02/19/2016 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to counts 1 and 3:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered counts 1 and 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence,  with credit for 11 days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent with the defendant's other case,  with the following conditions:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Defendant to notify agent if he has AODA issues.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.   Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

Defense motion for expungement denied by the court.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
At the request of defense counsel, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

15RM038676  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08-19-2015

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Dartavius L Spencer not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to bail. Court denied the defense request to modify bail. Defense requested scheduling conference. Defense counsel noted that due to representing the defendant on case #15CM1290 he will likely be assigned to this case as well. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.    Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Alexis S.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Dartavius L Spencer in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36 due to Lower Pending Case - 15CM1290.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
